column4: Hello all . I have an interesting porblem. I can't gain access to my computer (obviously not his one) for an apparently stupid reason. When the computer finish his boot, he won't show the space to enter my password. But here is he trick. If I try ctrl alt F1, the screen shut. If I try to boot in safe mode, the computer cracsh after loading the usb port and an live usb start fail with getpwuid_r(): failed due to unknown user id (
0). I checked the md5sum of he iso and it's good, beside the problems started after I did he first upgrade, not right after the installation. Dos someone have an idea?
So you are unable to boot into live USB?  Can you use a live CD instead to get into it?

After boot, you can also try alt-sysrq-k to try to get back to a console.  it should kill the x server.  You may have to do the ctrl-alt-f1 first to get to a console (even if it appears blank), then do the alt-sysrq-k.
what is sysrq?
suprr?
if not so marked on your keyboard, it would also be the same key as print-screen
it crashed
I have a few with point on scrren , and the cursor, frozen
can you boot off of a live CD instead, so that you can repair things?
I tried that (liveusb as I have no cddrive) and I got  getpwuid_r(): failed due to unknown user id (
any other idea?

hmm..well, since you already checked the MD5 checksum, the USB image seems good... maybe you are experiencing a hardware issue?  You might check your bios settings and refresh them for starters, maybe reseat the ram, check connections.
Yeah...
btw, which version of Ubuntu is on the USB?
the latest 10.10
yeah, hmm.  well I thought it might be related to an earlier bug in Lucid..:(
one possible problem could be that I have a wifi n card, or usb3 ports, as well as esata
well, I suppose, but the latest kernel should be supporting all of that, and at least not die like that if it doesn't for some reason.
you could always make another bootable USB using a recovery iso like this one - http://trinityhome.org/Home/index.php?content=TRINITY_RESCUE_KIT____CPR_FOR_YOUR_COMPUTER&front_id=12&lang=en&locale=en
